**2. Delegate and Ask for Help:**
Don't hesitate to delegate tasks to your spouse or other family members. Communicate your needs clearly and provide instructions. Don't be afraid to ask for help when needed.

**3. Set Boundaries:**
Establish clear boundaries between work and personal time. Avoid checking work emails or taking calls during family time. Protect your personal time to recharge and prevent burnout.

Schedule regular time for yourself to engage in activities that bring you joy and relaxation. This could include reading, exercising, or spending time with friends.

Openly discuss your feelings and concerns with your spouse. Express your need for support and understanding. Work together to find solutions that work for both of you.

If you're struggling to cope with stress and overwhelm, don't hesitate to seek professional help from a therapist or counselor. They can provide support, coping mechanisms, and guidance.
